response.message:
"...which we hope will help encourage our users to ask more questions."

I don't think we have a problem with quantity.
Curious badge links are all 404s

> The other angle we’re attacking this from is the low-quality algorithm.

I'm excited about this :)
@TylerH: That's... curious. Anyway, I fixed the links.

> We did some science and we threw a bunch of data into Vowpal Wabbit(not a typo) and built a predictor of question quality

Will this be enabled anywhere?

> We also redesigned the Hiring page. You should come work with us!

"the Hiring page" is supposed to be a link, but isn't at the moment.
@Jeff: Finding the hiring page is the first test in the process. (Just kidding. Fixed.)
like

When oh when will Salesforce SE leave beta... It's been a while, don't you think? 

http://blog.stackoverflow.com/2013/06/podcast-49-the-one-where-we-edited-out-the-title-reference/ was over 1 year ago.
My homepage is already StackOverflow ;D

The podcast mentions the low quality algorithm and how behind the scenes checks will still push questions in to the queue's that have to be dealt with.

It also mentions blocking and warning users when they ask a low quality question when it's felt we can teach them something. Could my suggestion on meta be a way to handle some of these cases and educate users, where it's felt they could learn something?

http://meta.stackoverflow.com/questions/260039/could-some-bad-questions-be-avoided-with-additional-prompting

You should seriously work on a duplicate question finder! If you find duplicate questions, force the users to click on them and check them off. They would probably find their answer.

If the question later gets closed as duplicate of one of those questions you had previously suggested, ban them from SO for life (or just not let them quickly check off suggested duplicates next time they ask a question and tell them why).
Do you have any numbers about the performance of the question quality predictor?  What are you measuring it against?
It might just be me, but the podcast download link fails every time ( on my Android phone).  I can listen from the Web page, but  none of the download links work.
Yes!

@Shahbaz "ban them from SO for life" Woah dude, calm down! calm down!
That's gonna negate SO's publicity and what if the banned person was a highly qualified person!!

>We redesigned the Stack Exchange homepage… again.

The hoomepage looks really good now. It's much easier to find good questions.
Why no Blackberry?

Does anyone know the name of the music track at the end of the podcast?

Thanks
For the Vopal Wabbit (or whatever it's called :P) they said starting with a capital letter is a good sign. That's not true on Apple SE! I don't want to have to type "Ipad."
I hope the receivers of the Socratic badge are not required to drink hemlock.

I'm not gonna lie, I hate "Sorry, but [etc.]" at the beginning of things. I think it's useless. It doesn't feel anymore human than "Sorry, but fuck you." (And the "sorry" at the beginning of that sentence makes it all the more frustrating).
